ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: As for him who thinks himself self-sufficient,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: As for him who is not in want of any thing,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: For him who does not care,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: As for him who thinks himself self-sufficient,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: As for him who considers himself free from need (of you),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: As for him who thinketh himself independent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: As for him who was indifferent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: As for him who regardeth himself self-sufficient-
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But as for someone who is wealthy,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: As to one who regards Himself as self-sufficient,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: As for him who thinks himself self-sufficient,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: As for he who is sufficed
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But as for him who was indifferent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: As for he who thinks himself without need,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [80:5] But as for the one [who thinks himself] self-sufficient, through wealth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 730 (As for him who thinketh himself independent) of Allah, i.e. the three men mentioned above,
